comment.author: 66311327@N05
comment._content: "Robert A.C. Smith (February 22, 1857 - July 27, 1933) was the Commissioner of Docks in New York City and a member of the Port and Terminal Committee of the Board of Estimate. He was also an entrepreneur in Cuba, having developed and operated railroads and utilities in the Caribbean island nation." en.wikipedia.org/wiki/R.A.C._Smith

comment.author: 66311327@N05
comment._content: John A. Topping was chairman of the Republic Iron and Steel Company, see New-York tribune., June 26, 1921, Page 8, with photo.

comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: NYT of February 20, 1916 select.nytimes.com/gst/abstract.html?res=F70B13F83E5E1373... reports on a lunch at the Whitehall Club at which ex-Senator Theodore E. Burton of Ohio addressed members on the topic of shipping. Topping was president of the club. Smith was at the speaker's table. Frederick B. Dalzell was present.

comment.author: 66311327@N05
23103743@N05
comment._content: NYT of May 7,1916 -- right-hand column (and other dates) select.nytimes.com/gst/abstract.html?res=F20B15FD3F5D1773... indicates that Fred B. Dalzell was a tug-boat operator and Vice-president of the New York Boat Owners Association
